TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed EventParameterType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Enumerates the types of data pointers passed to speech synthesis events.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.EventParameterType Object = int32(2)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.EventParameterType Pointer = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the argument to the is a created using referencing a object; may take on any value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.EventParameterType Token = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the argument to the is a

remarks.format:
## Remarks is a `System.IntPtr` created using `System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal.PtrToStructure`
referencing a Windows Desktop Speech Technology token --a Windows Desktop Speech Technology object representing a resource, such as a voice (<xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.VoiceInfo>); `param1` may take on any value.
> [!NOTE] > Currently instances of a managed synthetic speech engines, written using the members of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis> name space, cannot change resources after construction

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.EventParameterType Undefined = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the argument to the is undefined.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Generally, `param1` and `param2` are then ignored. However, if<xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TtsEventId> is <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TtsEventId.WordBoundary>, a progress meter event can be generated `param1` should be an integer containing the length of the current word, and `param2` a `System.IntPtr` referencing an integer containing the offset of the current word.
